intro: Culcitium boyacense, commonly known as the Boyacá culcitium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
